CatDescriptText: Mr. George Pratt, laboratory worker, Homewood and Mr. James Combs, steelworker, Brackenridge, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1962, pg. 12 with question: "How do you think the Pirates will do in 1962?" Mr. George Pratt's answer reads: "They could get the pennant, but the Yankees will get them then."  Mr. James Combs' answer reads: "They'll probably do a little better than they did last year.  I'll go out on a limb and say they'll end up in third place."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of George Pratt wearing dark tie with tie clip, light colored flecked jacket, and trench coat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of James Combs wearing light colored fedora, eyeglasses, and light colored coat with knitted collar, standing in front of C.C. Mellor's, Smithfield Street, Downtown
